alert.note: Alert for Darke; Miami (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 3:50PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN SHELBY, DARKE AND NORTHWESTERN MIAMI COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 350 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near New Madison, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, half inch hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Sidney, Piqua, Greenville, Versailles, Covington, Arcanum, Newport, Bradford, Fort Loramie, Ansonia, New Madison, Hardin, Webster, Wayne Lakes, Russia, Gettysburg, Hollansburg, Palestine, Lockington and Yorkshire. This includes I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 83 and 89. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
